page.title: 17WEST FELTON ECOLOGY
page.content: THE AREA IS GENTLY UNDULATING AND CONSISTS MAINLY OF FARM LAND ,WITH A SMALL STRETCH OF WOODLAND BY THE PRADOE ESTATE AND ROUND A DILAPIDATED MANSION CALLED THE NURSERY.THE LAND IS GENERALLY WELL KEPT AND CAREFULLY FARMED WITH VERY FEW PATCHES OF WASTE LAND IN THE AREA. THE WEATHER TENDS TO HAVE A VERY LOCAL PATTERN,OFTEN DIFFERING GREATLY FROM THAT OF OSWESTRY,ONLY 5 MILES AWAY,AND THE ELLESMERE AREA JUST TO THE NORTH.USUALLY THE WEATHER IS NOT SO SEVERE IN THIS AREA,AND THE SNOW LEVEL APPRECIABLY LESS THAN THAT OF OSWESTRY. THERE ARE MANY FOOTPATHS AROUND WEST FELTON,MANY LEADING TO THE CANAL,BUT ONE LEADS FROM THE VILLAGE CENTRE TO THE NOW-CLOSED RAILWAY STATION.MOST ARE MARKED WITH YELLOW ARROWS AND WOODEN SIGNPOSTS.
